intro: Tarasa cardenasii, commonly known as the Cadenas's tarasa, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It is known for its limited distribution and is considered endangered due to habitat loss and climate change. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
